data.title: Cloning a Node can result in a memory access violation
data.body: Calling Node::Clone() will cause a memory access violation if the node contains any children.

data.title: Selecting a Light in the editor is slow
data.body:
Create a node and a Light component in the editor to an empty scene. When alternating the hierarchy window selection between the node and the light component, the editor stalls for about half a second in debug mode. There should be no reason for that slow operation in a scene consisting of 1 node + 1 component.

May possibly be due to attribute editor refresh, as this also happens with other components containing a large number of attributes.

data.title: change doxygen location in readme to new github location
iOS build issue - universal library does not being built correctly
data.body: By default the iOS device build (ARCHS_STANDARD_32_BIT) builds two architectures, armv7 and armv7s. This results in two copies of each library (they go into different subdirectories). The object file selection for Urho3D library currently cannot cope with this. It erroneously only collects objects from armv7s architecture for these two libraries. It should collect objects in respect to the architecture.

data.title: Script Documentation missing Event Reference
data.body:
It would be nice to have a list of events in the script documentation.

Thanks,
Chris

data.title: DragBegin threshold
data.body:
The generic DragBegin should start after moving some pixels (10px?) or after some time (600ms?) after first click.  Configuration would be nice over hardcoded.  Otherwise this event is just seems too fussy.

Edit:
It may be useful to capture the dragElement on first click and then fire the DragBegin with that originating data after either of the 2 above conditions are met.

Thanks,
Chris

data.title: Duplicate ResourceDirs
data.body:
I am running the editor:

```
./Editor.sh -w -s
```

I do this:

``` cpp
    // collect all of the items and sort them afterwards
    for(uint i=0; i < cache.resourceDirs.length; i++)
    {
        Print(cache.resourceDirs[i]);
    }
```

I get this:

```
/Users/chrisfriesen/Desktop/Urho3D/bin/./CoreData/
/Users/chrisfriesen/Desktop/Urho3D/bin/./Data/
/Users/chrisfriesen/Desktop/Urho3D/Bin/Data/
```

Thanks,
Chris

data.title: Error link Urho3d
data.body:
I dont know if it's only a my issue,
i updated yesterday trunk at revision 2990 , all  urho's project compiled ok,
but when i compile my projects ( static lib , dll  and exe) i take and linker
error:

ChronoEngine.lib(SceneManager.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class Urho3D::Model \* __thiscall Urho3D::StaticModel::GetModel(void)const " (__imp_?GetModel@StaticModel@Urho3D@@QBEPAVModel@2@XZ)

I have already included urho3d.lib in my projects,
in warnings i see that static model has some problem:

2>Urho3D.lib(Model.obj) : warning LNK4221: This object file does not define any previously undefined public symbols, so it will not be used by any link operation that consumes this library.

i suppose that  it can  generated by precompiled issue  but i m not sure, now i m really tired,tomorrow it's an another day :+1:  
Someone has same issue?
thanks

--rev 2990 - VS 2010 sp1

data.title: alt-enter fullscreen - enables, doesn't disable after enabling
data.body:

Visual Studio 2010
-DENABLE_OPENGL=1 -DENABLE_LUAJIT=1

Urho3dPlayer Data/Scripts/09_MultipleViewports.as -w -s

Game loads up.  
Alt-Enter - Goes to fullscreen
Alt-Enter - Stays in fullscreen

data.title: Angelscript 2.28
data.body:
the new initializer syntax is very nice!

they added a dictionary type which isn't as useful but checkout the nice syntax

```
 dictionary dict = ({'one', 1}, {'object', object}, {'handle', @handle}};
```

it looks like there is syntax for multidimentional arrays

```
array<array<int>> b = {{1,2},{3,4}}
```

now if only they had anonymous methods and shorthand function notation.  watch out c#

data.title: Zone Fog Height option
data.body:
It would be nice to have the Zone fog feature to have a height attribute/value, similar to other engines like UDK, Unity and CryEngine:

http://docs.unity3d.com/Documentation/Components/script-GlobalFog.html
http://freesdk.crydev.net/display/SDKDOC2/Setting+Up+Weather+Effects#SettingUpWeatherEffects-Fog

This way a scene can have more detail and display a skybox and fog at the same time.

data.title: The command line argument parsing is making to many assumptions
It is too late to use LibRocket as UI system?
data.body:
I saw that this project implements its own ui system. However, I cannot avoid to suggest [Librocket](https://github.com/lloydw/libRocket)

But what is Librocket?: _"libRocket is the C++ user interface middleware package based on the HTML and CSS standards. It is designed as a complete solution for any project's interface needs._

_libRocket uses the time-tested open standards XHTML1.0 and CSS2.0 (while borrowing features from HTML5 and CSS3), and extends them with features suited towards real-time applications. Because of this, you don't have to learn a whole new proprietary technology like other packages in this middleware space."_

What do you think, guys? :)
